detail.content: Community & International Health Course Sequence                                                                                                        NYU.edu requires JavaScript be enabled in your browser in order to use important features of the site. JavaScript is either disabled or not supported by your browser. For instructions on how to enable JavaScript in your browser, click here .                New York University    Skip to Content   Skip to Search   Skip to Sub Navigation              Global Institute of Public Health                       Search NYU                    Pages |    People                                                                Bread Crumbs          Global Institute of Public Health   /   Academic Programs   /   Master of Public Health   /   Academics   /   Concentrations   /   Community and International Health                                                        Community & International Health Course Sequence          Full-Time Sample Sequence            First Year          Fall Semester (13 credits)  Spring Semester (12 credits)     GPH-GU 2190 Essentials of Public Health Biology (3)   PUHE-GE 2306 Epidemiology (3)   PUHE-GE 2355 Social & Behavioral Determinants of Health (3, Fall)   HPAM-GP 1830 Intro to Health Policy & Management (4, Fall, Spring)   GPH-GU 2171 Global Health Informatics I (0)   GPH-GU 2174 Readings in the History & Philosophy of Public Health I (0)*   GPH-GU 2180 Readings in the History & Philosophy of Public Health II (0)        GPH-GU 2995 Biostatistics for Public Health (3)   PUHE-GE 2361 Research Methods in Public Health (3)   PUHE-GE 2410 Community-Based Health Interventions OR PUHE-GE 2383 International Population & Family Health (3)   Concentration Course (3)   GPH-GU 2185 Readings in the History & Philosophy of Public Health III (0)          * this course is part of orientation.          Second Year          Fall Semester (12 credits)   Spring Semester (9 credits)     PUHE-GE 2356 Environmental Health Problems (3, Fall)   PUHE-GE 2318 Assessing Community Health Needs & Resources (3, Fall)   PUHE-GE 2349 Program Planning & Evaluation (3, Fall)   Elective (3)        GPH-GU 2360 Internship and Seminar in Public Health (3)   Concentration course (3)   Elective (3)          ** Students may take both PUHE-GE 2383 and PUHE-GE 2410 to fulfill their concentration course requirement. If only one is taken, another must be selected from the list of CIH concentration courses.   NOTE: With the exception of HPAM-GP 1830 Intro to Health Policy & Management, which is offered in both the Fall and Spring terms, all core courses are offered only in the terms shown above.          Part-Time Sample Sequences            Students completing the Community and International Health concentration on a part-time basis will work with an advisor to develop a plan based on the number of credits they would like to take each semester and the number of years they intend to take to complete the degree. Please click here for 3-year and 4-year SAMPLE sequences. Note: all students have a maximum of 6 years to complete the MPH requirements.                          CIH Checklist              Please click here to download a Community & International Health checklist for students who matriculated in Fall 2015.     The checklist outlines the requirements for the concentration, as well as which core and concentration courses have pre-requisites. Students are encouraged to use this tool as they move along in the program in order to help keep track of requirements for the degree.     Students who matriculated prior to Fall 2015 may find checklists and other information on the right side of this page . Epidemiology Degree Requirements                                                                                                        NYU.edu requires JavaScript be enabled in your browser in order to use important features of the site. JavaScript is either disabled or not supported by your browser. For instructions on how to enable JavaScript in your browser, click here .                New York University    Skip to Content   Skip to Search   Skip to Sub Navigation              Global Institute of Public Health                       Search NYU                    Pages |    People                                                                Bread Crumbs          Global Institute of Public Health   /   Academic Programs   /   Master of Public Health   /   Academics   /   Concentrations   /   Epidemiology                                                        Epidemiology Degree Requirements      46 credits            Public Health Core (18 credits)        All students in the Epidemiology concentration take the following core courses (18 credits) as part of the MPH degree requirements:     GPH-GU 2995 Biostatistics for Public Health (3)   GPH-GU 2106 Epidemiology (3)   GPH-GU 2110 Global Health Policy and Management (3)   GPH-GU 2140 Global Issues in Social and Behavioral Health (3)   GPH-GU 2153 Global Environmental Health (3)   GPH-GU 2190 Essential of Public Health Biology (3)   GPH-GU 2171 Global Health Informatics I (0)   GPH-GU 2175 Readings in the History & Philosophy of Public Health I (0)*     GPH-GU 2180 Readings in the History & Philosophy of Public Health II (0)   GPH-GU 2185 Readings in the History & Philosophy of Public Health III (0)            * this course takes place during orientation            Concentration courses (15 credits)        All students in the Epidemiology concentration take:     GPH-GU 2450 Intermediate Epidemiology (Sp, 3)   GPH-GU 2930 Epidemiology Design & Methods (Fa, 3)   GPH-GU 2920 Biostatistics: Regression & Multivariable Modeling (Sp, 3)     Plus 6 credits from the following:     GPH-GU 2225 Psychometric Measurement & Analysis in Public Health Research and Practice (Fa, 3)   GPH-GU 2160 Qualitative and Field Methods (Sp, 3)   PUHE-GE 2361 Research Methods in Public Health (Sp, 3)              Electives (9 credits)        Choose from the following:     GPH-GU 2317 Social Epidemiology Methods (Sp, 3)   GPH-GU 2240 Problems, Prospects, and Principles of Global Mental Health (Fa, 3)   GPH-GU 2230 Global Non-Communicable Disease Epi and Control (Sp, 3)   GPH-GU 2420 Genetic Epidemiology (3)   GPH-GU 2410 Global Burden of Infectious Disease (Sp, 3)   GPH-GU 2416 Neuroepidemiology (Sp, 3)   PUHE-GE 2317 Global Issues in Public Health and Nutrition, Puebla, Mexico (Jan -3 cr)              Culminating Experience (4 credits)        Students complete a two-semester research paper in the courses below, which serves as the culminating experience of the MPH degree.     GPH-GU 2686 Thesis I: Research & Thesis Development (2)   GPH-GU 2687 Thesis II: Research & Thesis Presentation (2)                                            Information about Epidemiology        Thesis I and II                              Online Courses:        Beginning Fall 2015, the following 5 public health core courses will be available to take online. Students may choose to enroll in lieu of the in-person equivalent courses which are noted in parentheses below:     GPH-GU 5106 Epidemiology (GPH-GU 2106)   GPH-GU 5995 Biostatistics for Public Health (GPH-GU 2995)   GPH-GU 5153 Global Environmental Health (GPH-GU 2153)   GPH-GU 5140 Global Issues in Social and Behavioral Health (GPH-GU 2140)   GPH-GU 5110 Global Health Policy and Management (GPH-GU 2110)     Further information about online courses may be found here . Community and International Health Degree Requirements                                                                                                        NYU.edu requires JavaScript be enabled in your browser in order to use important features of the site. JavaScript is either disabled or not supported by your browser. For instructions on how to enable JavaScript in your browser, click here .                New York University    Skip to Content   Skip to Search   Skip to Sub Navigation              Global Institute of Public Health                       Search NYU                    Pages |    People                                                                Bread Crumbs          Global Institute of Public Health   /   Academic Programs   /   Master of Public Health   /   Academics   /   Concentrations   /   Community and International Health                                                        Community and International Health Degree Requirements      46 Credits        Public Health Core Courses (28 credits)             All students in the Community and International Health concentration take the following 12 core courses (28 credits) as part of the MPH degree requirements:     GPH-GU 2995 Biostatistics for Public Health (3)   GPH-GU 2190 Essentials of Public Health Biology (3)   PUHE-GE 2306 Epidemiology (3)   PUHE-GE 2318 Assessing Community Health Needs & Resources (3)   PUHE-GE 2349 Program Planning & Evaluation (3)   PUHE-GE 2355 Social & Behavioral Determinants of Health (3)   PUHE-GE 2356 Environmental Health Problems (3)   PUHE-GE 2361 Research Methods in Public Health (3)   HPAM-GP 1830 Introduction to Health Policy & Management (4)   GPH-GU 2171 Global Health Informatics I (0)   GPH-GU 2175 Readings in the History & Philosophy of Public Health I (0)*   GPH-GU 2180 Readings in the History & Philosophy of Public Health II (0)   GPH-GU 2185 Readings in the History & Philosophy of Public Health III (0)          * this course is taken during orientation.          Concentration Courses (6 credits)            Students in the Community and International Health concentration take:       PUHE-GE 2410 Community-Based Health Interventions (3)  - OR -    PUHE-GE 2383 International Population & Family Health (3)       Plus 3 credits from the following list of concentration courses:       NUTR-GE 2187 Global Issues in Nutrition (3)    PUHE-GE 2314 International Health and Economic Development (3)    PUHE-GE 2316 Community Health: A Society in Transition: South Africa (6)    PUHE-GE 2317 Global Issues in Public Health: Puebla Mexico (3)    PUHE-GE 2319 Writing Grants and Funding Proposals for Health-Related Programs (3)    PUHE-GE 2335 Advocating for Community Health (3)    PUHE-GE 2374 Perspectives on Reproductive Health (3)    PUHE-GE 2405 Health Communication: Theory and Practice (3)                 Elective Courses (9 credits)           Students in the Community and International Health Concentration select 9 elective credits from the list of pre-approved NYU MPH elective options . If a student would like to take a public health or policy-related course which does not appear on this list, they may contact giph.registration@nyu.edu .            Culminating Experience (3 credits)            Students in the Community and International Health concentration complete a minimum of 180 hours of a public health internship , which serves as the culminating experience of the MPH degree.       PUHE-GE 2360 Internship in Public Health (3 credits)       Click here for more information about the Internship culminating experience.                                                   Online Courses:        Beginning Fall 2015, the following 5 public health core courses will be available to take online. Students may choose to enroll in lieu of the in-person equivalent courses which are noted in parentheses below:     GPH-GU 5106 Epidemiology (PUHE-GE 2306)   GPH-GU 5995 Biostatistics for Public Health (GPH-GU 2995)   GPH-GU 5153 Global Environmental Health (PUHE-GE 2356)   GPH-GU 5140 Global Issues in Social and Behavioral Health (PUHE-GE 2355)   GPH-GU 5110 Global Health Policy and Management (HPAM-GP 1830)     Further information about online courses may be found here .
